IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: The following incident was captured on the in-car camera of Maryland State Police unmarked unit DUI-6: Title and ID: 23-MSP-023519. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Checkpoint Manager: Maryland State Police Lieutenant David Ryan #2795. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> On June 30, 2023, a DUI checkpoint was completed on Boston Street at S East Ave in Baltimore City, Maryland. The checkpoint started at approximately 2240 hours and concluded at approximately 0140 hours. Troopers, Officers, and Deputies from The Maryland State Police, Maryland Transportation Authority Police, Baltimore City Police, and Baltimore City Sheriffs Office staffed the checkpoint which complied with MSP Policy. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> The following statistics were compiled from the checkpoint: font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> A total of 590 vehicles passed through the checkpoint. Of those vehicles, 4 vehicles were pulled from the line to conduct standardized field sobriety testing. Of those vehicles, 2 persons were arrested for DUI. font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> The checkpoint was set up in conformity with the Maryland State Police rules and regulations. Video was taken of the checkpoint, displaying the proper notice and exit. First notice sign was set 435 feet prior to the last exit at S Ellwood Avenue. (Measured by TFC Jackson #6481) font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Attached is the DUI checkpoint driver/vehicle data sheet and supporting YTD impaired driving crashes by injury data. All events occurred in Baltimore City, Maryland.
